text: Identification of upstream regulatory elements that repress expression of adult beta-like globin genes in a primitive erythroid environment .

Our investigations have focused on localizing cis-elements responsible for the down regulation of the adult beta-like globin genes ( <extra_id_0> delta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) in immature , or primitive erythroid tissues .

text: We studied their activity after transfection into K562 cells , an erythroleukemia cell line with an embryonic-fetal phenotype .

Analyzed DNA sequences included <extra_id_0> delta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> 5 ' flanking regions extending from approximately -500 to +50bp ( promoter regions ) , truncated <extra_id_0> delta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> 5 ' flanking regions extending from approximately -250 to +50 bp , and chimeric promoter constructions , which consisted of a distal <extra_id_0> delta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or <extra_id_0> beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> fragment fused to a proximal <extra_id_0> beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or <extra_id_0> delta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> sequence .

In <extra_id_0> CAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> reporter constructions no appreciable level of <extra_id_0> CAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activity was supported by the <extra_id_0> beta globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter , and only low level activity by the <extra_id_0> delta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .

text: Truncation of the <extra_id_0> beta globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter led to a 2-3 fold increase in promoter activity .
In contrast , deletion of the upstream portion of the <extra_id_0> delta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter led to a 10 fold decrease in expression .

Coupling of the upstream <extra_id_0> beta globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> sequence from approximately -500 to -250 bp to the truncated <extra_id_0> delta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter fragment led to complete extinction of transcription activity , consistent with a negative regulatory effect of the <extra_id_0> beta globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene upstream element ( s ) .

Fusion of the upstream portion of the <extra_id_0> delta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter to the truncated <extra_id_0> beta globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter yielded a modest increase in promoter strength relative to the truncated <extra_id_0> beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene promoter , indicating the presence of a positive transcriptional element ( s ) in the upstream <extra_id_0> delta globi <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> n regulatory region .

Site - directed mutagenesis of binding sites for the repressor proteins <extra_id_0> BP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> BP2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in the upstream portion of the <extra_id_0> beta globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene flanking region led to a 4-6 fold increase in promoter activity .

<extra_id_0> DNase I <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> footprinting of the upstream <extra_id_0> delta-globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> region revealed protected sequences corresponding to consensus binding sites for <extra_id_0> GATA-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> BP2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

These results confirm that sequences in the upstream promoter region of the adult <extra_id_0> beta globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene contribute to its factor - mediated suppression early in development and then may modulate its expression at a later stage .
